post.description:
Validate if a place exists and has a digital footprint using AI-powered web search and analysis.

Given a natural language query like "Starbucks Market and 8th st san francisco", this endpoint 
performs comprehensive analysis to determine:

**Digital Footprint Analysis:**
- Web presence, social media accounts, official websites, and online mentions
- Strength of digital presence (HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW, NONE)

**Entity Type Classification:**
- Determines if the query represents a place, address only, person name, geographic area, or other entity type

**Place Definition:**
- Identifies the type of place: physical storefront, residential, temporary event, digital-only business (e.g., ghost kitchens, eCommerce), etc.

**Place Reality - Location Match Granularity:**
- **house_number**: Evidence found at exact address including street number (e.g., "123 Main St")
- **nearby**: Evidence found on same street but without exact house number (e.g., "Main St" in same city)
- **broad**: Evidence found in general area/city but at different street or only partial address match
- **none**: Unable to match the place to any specific location

**Important Notes:**
- This endpoint validates place existence and digital presence, but does NOT determine if a place is currently open or closed
- For open/closed status verification, use the `closed_permanently` enrichment via the `/enrich` endpoint

value.query: Burger Den 12405 Westheimer Rd, Houston, TX 77077
Starbucks Market and 8th st san francisco
Apple Store 300 post st San Francisco CA
Hogwarts school of witchcraft and wizardry, highlands, scotland, Great Britan
Syncup AI Inc, 201 3rd st, San Francisco, CA

post.description:
Match a place against multiple geospatial data sources using AI-powered conflation algorithms.

Given information about a place (address, name, coordinates) we will find the right place. This is also called entity resolution.

Reprompt supports multiple backends for matching against:
- **[Foursquare OS Places](https://opensource.foursquare.com/os-places/)** - amazing open data project with 100M+ global POIs (Apache 2.0 license)
- **[Overture Places](https://overturemaps.org/)** - open map data from the Overture Maps Foundation with 64M+ places (CDLA Permissive 2.0)
- **Our index** of places we picked up from crawling the web
- **Your own data** - supply your own candidates to match against

**Key Use Cases:**
1. Data cleaning: Clean messy/inconsistent place data against authoritative sources
2. Deduplication: Find duplicate places across different datasets
3. Grounding:If you're building AI agents and users are mentioning places or work with plae data, use placematch to ground in the right place.

In order to match places you need to provide one of the following:
- Name + Address: Provide `place.name` + `place.address`
- Name + Address + Coordinates (most accurate): Provide `place.name` + `place.address` + `place.latitude` + `place.longitude`

Matching considers the available input data. Under the hood we use a combination of name similarity, geographic proximity and distance, category alignment, address components
to find candidates and match them with our fined-tuned LLM.

precise_matching.description: Most precise matching mode using all available place information

results.name: Blue Bottle Coffee
results.reasoning: High confidence match: very close location (12m away) with precise GPS coordinates

results.name: McDonald's
results.reasoning: Good match: normalized name similarity and location within acceptable range

value.message: Must provide at least a name OR coordinates
Both latitude and longitude must be provided together
Address can only be provided together with a name

501.description: Feature not yet supported (coordinates-only searches, etc.)

post.description: Search for places within a defined geographic area with optional name and category filters.

lat_lon_radius.description: Point-based search within specified radius. Returns results sorted by distance.

geometry_polygon.description: Area-based search within GeoJSON polygon boundaries.

locality.description: Search all places within a city/town boundary.

postal_code.description: Search all places within a postal/ZIP code area.

region.description: Search all places within a state or province boundary.

dataset_mode_basic.description: Create Reprompt batches from search results. Batches are created with kick_off_jobs_now=false (you select attributes in the app). Auto-chunks large result sets (max 50k jobs per batch). Includes prefilled data for phone, website, and open/closed status. Returns app URLs to manage batches.

200.description: Successfully found places or created datasets

nearby_results.description: Default output mode. Returns results sorted by distance with distance_m field.

polygon_results.description: Area-based search. Results sorted by name, no distance_m field.

400.description: Invalid input, validation error, or too many batches

details.msg: Must provide one location filter type

too_many_batches.description: Query would exceed 200-batch limit (10M places max)

value.message: Query would generate 250 batches, exceeding the limit of 200. Please narrow your query or increase max_jobs_per_batch (current: 50000, max: 50000).

no_results_dataset.description: Cannot create dataset with 0 results. Adjust search filters.

value.detail: No results found. Cannot create dataset with 0 places. Please adjust your search filters.

500.description: Internal error with error ID for support tracking

internal_error.description: An unexpected error occurred. The error ID can be provided to support for troubleshooting.

value.message: An internal error occurred while processing your request. Please contact support with error ID: 5b15d005-4102-4bbc-a0b8-d01490765276

location_filter.description:
Location filter for geographic search.

**Location Filter Types (choose exactly one):**
- **Lat/Lon + Radius**: Point-based search within specified radius (default 500m, max 10km)
- **GeoJSON Geometry**: Area-based search within Polygon or MultiPolygon boundaries
- **Locality**: Search within a city/town (requires country_code)
- **Postal Code**: Search within a postal/ZIP code area (requires country_code)
- **Region**: Search within a state/province (requires country_code)

categories.title: Categories
categories.description: Category/categories to filter by. **Category Schemas by Source:** **Reprompt & Overture**: Use [Overture Maps schema](https://docs.overturemaps.org/schema/concepts/by-theme/places/) (e.g., 'cafe', 'restaurant', 'hospital'). **Foursquare**: Use [Foursquare category taxonomy](https://docs.foursquare.com/data-products/docs/categories) (e.g., 'Food and Beverage > Restaurant', 'Retail > Grocery Store'). We will match against all the child categories of parent categories.

source.description:
Data source to search: reprompt (default), overture, or foursquare.

Reprompt supports multiple backends for finding places:
- **[Foursquare OS Places](https://opensource.foursquare.com/os-places/)** - amazing open data project with 100M+ global POIs (Apache 2.0 license)
- **[Overture Places](https://overturemaps.org/)** - open map data from the Overture Maps Foundation with 64M+ places (CDLA Permissive 2.0)
- **Our index** of places we picked up from crawling the web

This endpoint provides a search experience for finding places of interest (POIs) using various location filters and data sources with optimized spatial indexes for fast queries.

**Category Schemas by Source:**
- **Reprompt & Overture**: Use [Overture Maps schema](https://docs.overturemaps.org/schema/concepts/by-theme/places/) (e.g., "cafe", "restaurant", "hospital")
- **Foursquare**: Use [Foursquare category taxonomy](https://docs.foursquare.com/data-products/docs/categories) (e.g., "Food and Beverage > Restaurant", "Retail > Grocery Store")
- We will match against all the child categories of parent categories.

output_mode.description: Output mode: 'results' returns results directly, 'reprompt_dataset' creates Reprompt batches

batch_name_prefix.title: Batch Name Prefix
batch_name_prefix.description: Batch name prefix for dataset mode (e.g., 'hcm_sample_'). Defaults to 'find_places_'

max_jobs_per_batch.title: Max Jobs Per Batch
max_jobs_per_batch.description: Max jobs per batch for dataset mode (â‰¤50,000). If omitted, uses 50,000

num_batches.title: Num Batches
num_batches.description: Target number of batches for dataset mode. If both max_jobs_per_batch and num_batches provided, max_jobs_per_batch takes precedence

metadata.description: Metadata about the find places operation

FindPlacesResponse.title: FindPlacesResponse
FindPlacesResponse.description:
Unified response model for find_places endpoint.

This response structure is used for both 'results' and 'reprompt_dataset' output modes.
- results: Always present, contains up to 500 places
- metadata.total_results: Total count of places found
- metadata.datasets: Only present when output_mode='reprompt_dataset', contains batch information

LocationFilter.title: LocationFilter
LocationFilter.description:
Location filter for place search.

Supports multiple filter types (mutually exclusive):
1. Lat/Lon/Radius: Provide latitude, longitude, and optionally radius (default 500m)
2. Geometry: Provide geometry as GeoJSON object
3. Region: Provide region and country_code
4. Postal Code: Provide postal_code (and optionally country_code)
5. Locality: Provide locality and country_code

These sources are available across both the placematch API (for entity resolution)
and the find-places API (for geographic search).
